definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Let bad luck come down on both the houses.
sentences.chinese: 让坏运降临到这两个家庭吧。

sentences.english: Nothing happens by chance or by means of good or bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么事情是因为好运或者坏运而发生的。

sentences.english: Behind bad luck comes good luck.
The bad luck will show up this month, so be careful for the fight with others.
sentences.chinese: 坏运将在这个月出现，所以要小心可能和别人争吵。

sentences.english: Walking under a ladder will bring bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 从梯子下走过会带来坏运。

sentences.english: What may appear as bad fortune may in fact be the door that is just waiting to be opened.
sentences.chinese: 看起来像坏运的可能像一扇门一样正等着你打开。

sentences.english: Good luck rarely commands one's attention like bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 好运很少象坏运那样引人注意。

definition: variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
fateful accident/inauspicious matter (involving death or casualties)
year of one's birth sign, according to the cycle of 12 animals of the earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1]
